Key Arguments: The legislation is unnecessary as existing laws already address speech crimes like defamation and inciting violence.
The bill could be used to shut down lawful discussions on social issues, effectively eradicating political beliefs contrary to the mainstream.
The threat of massive fines to private companies will lead to excessive censorship.
The definitions of harm in the bill are vague and subjective, potentially weaponizing the bill against free speech.
The bill could lead to unjust censorship and represents a step towards a Big Brother state.
